headline.print_headline: Winter Poses New Danger for Migrants
headline.main: Winter Poses New Danger for Migrants

byline.contributor: Barbara Surk contributed reporting from Ljubljana, Slovenia, Kimberly Bradley from Traiskirchen, Austria, and Joe Orovic from Cakovec, Croatia.

snippet: Cold weather and closing borders are complicating the arduous path from Syria and other war-torn nations into the heart of Western Europe.
abstract: Coming winter presents challenges and numerous dangers to migrants traveling unofficial humanitarian corridor through Balkans to Europe; combination of severe winter weather and possible border closings has raised prospect that stream of migrants will become backlogged and many will be confined to camps that are not outfitted to deal with cold.
lead_paragraph: Cold weather and closing borders are complicating the arduous path from Syria and other war-torn nations into the heart of Western Europe.
